column4: while trying to configure x server and get kicked out for overwriting possible-customised configuration file.  not sure what this means but it happens when I get to the monitor color information
If i understand you correctly, you got the notice you were overriding a possibly customized file?
That's what happens when you use dpkg-reconfigure to GUI re-do the X server when you have previously manually edited xorg.conf
how do I do that requin
i assume you used 'sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg' ?
and it kicks you out with that error when you get to the moniter section?
Um, are you sure it isn't just finished?
requin, no, it says ubuntu@ubuntu:~$ at the bottom after the warning
Try restarting X and see if that fixes the problem you were trying to fix
ok, how do I restart x?
